page.title: 09BROUGHTY FERRY-LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: Although now a suburb of Dundee, Broughty Ferry still retains much of its individual character. It is an important part of Tayside Region's many attractions. Situated four miles east of the City Centre, it still shows many signs of its origins as a fishing village clustered close to the Tay. In the past a ferry operated for many years between Broughty Ferry Castle and Tayport on the Fife bank of the Tay.During the 19th Century, Broughty Ferry, then an independent burgh, became the favoured residential area of many of the Dundee business men who prospered with the development of the Jute trade both here and in India. Many of their fine houses are still to be seen, some now converted to hotels, Institutions and flats.
